agentInstructions.title: Pre-Development Instructions for A.I.D.A. Agent
agentInstructions.description: Based on the comprehensive documentation in the @docs/ folder and the Final Sprint & Demo Guide, here are the instructions that should be given to an agent before continuing work on the A.I.D.A. project

mandatoryProtocol.description: Before making ANY changes to the codebase, you MUST:

documentationRequirements.description: Brand identity, messaging, and go-to-market strategy
Complete demo blueprint and presentation strategy
Project foundation and strategic pivot context

sprintContext.priority: Landing page refactor, dashboard polish, and demo execution
sprintContext.status: Documentation aligned, ready for final technical implementation
sprintContext.focus: Community Engagement Hub - The Voice of Your School District

finalSprintPlan.part1: Landing Page Refactor - Professional presentation of value proposition
finalSprintPlan.part2: Dashboard Refactor - Voice-first interface with RAG-powered chat
finalSprintPlan.part3: Demo Scripts - Story-driven presentation for 3 personas (Sarah, Maria, Michael)

criticalPriorities: Voice Orb state management with correct color specifications
Source document display for trust signals
Professional UI/UX presentation for hackathon judges

scenes.description: Sarah (Educator) - District policy questions via voice
Maria (Parent) - Bus schedule and family information

technicalRequirements: Voice assistant with <2s response time (critical for demo)

architecture.frontend: React + TypeScript + Vite + Tailwind CSS (deployed on Vercel)
architecture.backend: Convex (real-time database and serverless functions, deployed on Convex Cloud)
architecture.dataIngestion: Direct document upload (PDFs, text files) - web scraping removed for simplicity

successCriteria.title: ðŸ“Š Success Criteria (Per PRD)
mvpSuccess: Multiple stakeholders (teacher, parent, administrator) can ask voice questions about district policy and get accurate, sourced answers

The solution addresses a real, validated problem in education: fragmented district information

hackathonSuccess: Voice assistant answers district-specific questions accurately

conclusion.title: Remember
conclusion.message: This is a hackathon project with a story-driven demo requirement. The focus is on implementing the Final Sprint Guide specifications to create a compelling presentation that showcases A.I.D.A. as 'The Voice of Your School District' through the 3-persona demo script (Sarah, Maria, Michael).
